review: was a head of its time when it came out for me its better than modern xcom 2 although i have to admit i play the game with the money cheat to start with couple of million to get a head start otherwise its to difficult for me love the slow build up as you research the aliens and i choose the turn based gameplay with mission  to better plan my tactical approach

one of the best early xcom games the real time battle and lack of earthscape we got city scape instead might put some people off but the amount of care and detail that has been put into it makes up for it

3rd installment from the original xcom series  julian gollop  loved the fact real time combat was implemented that youre only looking after a mega city that you can raid organisations that hate you or side with the alien menace  economic warefare   and that base defenses are aided by way of security towers plus amazing ship combat and not too taxing tactical combat
good old classic

awesome i had not played this game in decades loving it again
stylish and creepy this game involves project management and squadlevel combat

this game is great considering its age i go back to play this because nobody has made a new version like enemy unknown which i feel is a real missed opportunity as this game combines looking after everything i want in an xcom game

still the best xcom multilevel fully destructable terrain and a broad range of interesting weapons open up a realistic and interesting range of scifi battle tactics the following games failed to capture also asymetric threats aliens found in an enemy building complex just take  your big guns and level the whole complex surely not the optimal way to play but just so satisfying to see whole towers collapse
just as good as it ever was
those pesky aliens

best of the xcom series challenging and extremely addictive very satisfying gameplay with different types of aliens surviving in mars along other organizations
